subject: Re: Test genes, test infected rates, and test-resistant managers
msgSnippet: ... Hi David, Thanks for your story. I also hope that developer testing wins with grass-root /developer support instead of management mandate - how boring
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:

> In the end, I think that if developer testing scores a Major Victory,
> it may end up being a developer-driven victory, more like version
> control or automated builds, rather than a manager-driven victory,
> like QA (of course an over-simplification).
>
> David Saff
>

Hi David,

Thanks for your story.

I also hope that developer testing "wins" with "grass-root"/developer
support instead of management mandate - how boring would that be :-).

I actually think that a developer-driven victory would be the only
sustainable victory.

Alberto
